EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.95}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.02}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Ingredients on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Ingredients on the x-axis is {0.80}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Sustainability on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Sustainability on the y-axis is {0.92}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Safety on the y-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Safety on the y-axis is {0.31}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Produce and Consumption or the cell corresponding to Frozen and Exports?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Produce} and {Consumption} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Bakery and Exports or the cell corresponding to Produce and Sustainability?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Bakery} and {Exports} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Dairy and Production or the cell corresponding to Produce and Production?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Produce} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.32 to 0.54?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Dairy, Consumption), (Ingredients, Consumption), (Dairy, Exports), (Ingredients, Exports), (Seafood, Exports), (Dairy, Innovation), (Ingredients, Innovation), (Meat, Innovation), (Bakery, Prices), (Snacks, Prices), (Frozen, Production), (Produce, Production), (Meat, Regulations), (Dairy, Safety), (Frozen, Safety), (Meat, Sustainability), (Produce, Sustainability)}.
